meanings.definition: Make (an action or process) happen sooner or be accomplished more quickly.
meanings.sent1: She expedited the delivery of the package.
meanings.sent2: The manager expedited the approval process for the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef expedited the cooking of the meal, making everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking expedited the resolution of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The teacher expedited the grading of the exams to give prompt feedback.

meanings.definition: Process (something, especially a piece of business) quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: The company expedited the order to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The team expedited the paperwork to finalize the deal.
meanings.sent3: The robot expedited the assembly line, impressing everyone with its speed.
meanings.sent4: The computer program expedited the data processing, saving valuable time.
meanings.sent5: The nurse expedited the patient's paperwork to ensure a smooth discharge process.
